intro: Pachycymbium kochii, commonly known as the giant spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, thick, and fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a distinctive structure typical of the spurge family. Its stems are erect and can grow quite tall, sometimes reaching several meters in height. Pachycymbium kochii is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in savannah or woodland habitats.
